title: [K-12] Design Thinking-Based Business Model Innovation Practicum: Integrating Language Communication Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of basic business administration and marketing concepts, ability to apply fundamental grammar and vocabulary for business document creation
context.additional_context: Conducted in a smartphone-centric, limited technological environment, with a focus on applying design thinking methodologies to solve real business problems. Special emphasis is placed on constructing persuasive texts and presentation language strategies for explaining business models.

learning_goals: Develop the ability to generate new business models using the design thinking process based on real-world cases and articulate them linguistically with clarity.
Cultivate practical skills to validate business model feasibility through prototyping and user feedback, and report analytical results in structured written form.
Acquire communication skills by utilizing effective listening, speaking, and writing techniques during the process of refining innovative solutions through collaboration with diverse stakeholders.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
